title: Kill the Bill Manchester protest: 18 arrested after protesters block tram lines
description: But the Kill the Bill protest in Manchester is described as "largely peaceful" by police.

title: Wales 1-0 Mexico: Kieffer Moore strikes as Chris Gunter wins 100th cap
description: Kieffer Moore scores the only goal as a much-changed Wales side mark Chris Gunter's 100th cap with a friendly win over Mexico.

title: Myanmar coup: Dozens killed as army opens fire on protesters during deadliest day
description: Dozens of deaths are reported as anti-coup protesters defy warnings and take to the streets.

title: Republic of Ireland slump to home Luxembourg defeat
description: The Republic of Ireland's World Cup qualifying hopes are dealt a blow as they slump to a disastrous home defeat by Luxembourg in Dublin.

title: Jedward shave off their famous quiffs for cancer charity
description: The Irish twins removed each other's quiffs live on TV in memory of their late mother.

title: Green Homes Grant scheme to insulate houses axed
description: Homeowners were invited to apply for grants to insulate houses but the scheme is being suddenly ended.

title: Covid: 'Christmas Day' for families as Wales lifts travel ban
description: The 'stay local' rule has been scrapped, allowing unlimited travel within Wales from Saturday.

title: Manchester City 1-0 Reading: Chloe Kelly's late winner puts City top of Women's Super League
description: Chloe Kelly scores a late winner against Reading to move Manchester City to the top of the Women's Super League.

title: Wada investigating 2010 GB cyclist nandrolone test
description: Wada launches an investigation after it emerges the sample of a British Cycling rider contained traces of the steroid nandrolone after a test in late 2010.

title: Charlie Hughes: Parents of boy with epilepsy drop NICE high court challenge
description: The family of three-year-old Charlie Hughes had brought a judicial review against NICE guidance.

title: Covid-19: Arlene Foster gets AstraZeneca vaccine
description: The DUP leader praises the "positive community spirit" and "collective effort" vaccination centres.

title: Fleetwood, Garcia and Rahm into WGC Matchplay quarter-finals
description: England's Tommy Fleetwood hits a hole-in-one as he moves into the quarter-finals of the WGC Matchplay in Texas alongside Sergio Garcia and Jon Rahm.

title: Covid: England lockdown easing still on course, says PM
description: Boris Johnson says the "roadmap to freedom" will continue, even as infections rise across Europe.

title: Cambridge University: Butterfly found pressed inside centuries-old book
description: A university says a butterfly found in a book could be hundreds of years old.

title: Pembrokeshire walrus seen 'basking in sun' in Tenby
description: From North Pole to Pembrokeshire, a walrus seems to be continuing his trip around the Welsh coast.

title: The visual effects challenge of Snyder’s Justice League
description: Two Weta Digital experts explain how they updated the characters' look.

title: Max Verstappen takes pole position at Bahrain Grand Prix ahead of Lewis Hamilton
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen beats Lewis Hamilton's Mercedes to take a stunning pole position at the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix.

title: Facebook freezes Maduro's page over Covid claim
description: Venezuela's president will not be able to post for 30 days for disinformation over a herbal remedy.

title: Suez Canal: Fresh effort to refloat wedged container ship
description: Tugs are taking advantage of a high tide to try to dislodge the ship blocking a key shipping route.

title: MP Kenny MacAskill quits SNP for new Alba Party
description: The SNP call for a by-election in East Lothian and describe his departure as "somewhat of a relief".

title: Man Utd women win in first match at Old Trafford
description: Teenager Lauren James scores as Manchester United beat West Ham in their first Women's Super League match at Old Trafford.

title: Nicola Sturgeon: 'Significant questions' over Salmond election bid
description: Nicola Sturgeon's comments come after Alex Salmond confirmed he would stand for a new pro-independence party.

title: Apophis asteroid will not hit Earth for 100 years, Nasa says
description: The space agency rules out a 2068 threat to Earth from the "poster child for hazardous asteroids".

title: Ivermectin: South African medics using unproven worm drug to treat Covid-19
description: Some South African medics are going to court to seek permission to prescribe Ivermectin to Covid patients.

title: Sŵnami: 'Why can't we sing in Welsh and be successful?'
description: As streaming opens audiences to Welsh language bands, Sŵnami say it's getting easier to break through.

title: Covid lockdown projects: How you danced, wrote, ran and invented games
description: You told us what projects kept you going in lockdown, from dancing to writing and inventing games.

title: German Covid Easter U-turn shakes Merkel's cool, calm image
description: Chancellor Merkel takes political flak as Germany struggles to agree on lockdown measures.

title: Home-schooling around the world: How have we coped?
description: Indigenous children have been hit hardest and the crisis has reached a "tipping point", say experts

title: The vaccine misinformation battle raging in France
description: Online conspiracy theories are exacerbating existing vaccine scepticism.

title: 'Ice-cream toothache' mystery explained
description: Scientists say they have worked out how teeth become sensitive and hurt with cold food and drinks.

title: The challenge facing Joe Biden at the border
description: Can the new president match his words on the campaign trail with action?

title: Baby goat, emu and goose make friends on Wiltshire farm
description: The three arrivals at Caenhill Countryside Centre in Wiltshire have become social media stars.

title: Faith and ritual: Religion in 21st century Britain
description: From birth, to coming of age, marriage and death, how do five religions celebrate these crucial moments?

title: Covid: Grassroots sports get ready for lockdown release
description: Millions of people across England are preparing for outdoor grassroots sports being allowed again from Monday.

title: BBC reporter records phone call with fraudster
description: BBC Money Box reporter Dan Whitworth was phoned by a fraudster and managed to record the call.
